name: UInputKeySelector
doc: A widget for selecting a single key or a single key with a modifier.

WidgetStyle: The button style used at runtime
TextStyle: The button style used at runtime
Margin: The amount of blank space around the text used to display the currently selected key.
OnKeySelected: Called whenever a new key is selected by the user.
OnIsSelectingKeyChanged: Called whenever the key selection mode starts or stops.
bAllowModifierKeys:
When true modifier keys such as control and alt are allowed in the
input chord representing the selected key, if false modifier keys are ignored.
bAllowGamepadKeys: When true gamepad keys are allowed in the input chord representing the selected key, otherwise they are ignored.
KeySelectionText: Sets the text which is displayed while selecting keys.
NoKeySpecifiedText: Sets the text to display when no key text is available or not selecting a key.
EscapeKeys: When true gamepad keys are allowed in the input chord representing the selected key, otherwise they are ignored.

methods.name: GetIsSelectingKey
methods.doc: Returns true if the widget is currently selecting a key, otherwise returns false.

methods.name: SetAllowGamepadKeys
methods.doc: Sets whether or not gamepad keys are allowed in the selected key.

methods.name: SetAllowModifierKeys
methods.doc: Sets whether or not modifier keys are allowed in the selected key.

methods.name: SetKeySelectionText
methods.doc: Sets the text which is displayed while selecting keys.

methods.name: SetNoKeySpecifiedText
methods.doc: Sets the text to display when no key text is available or not selecting a key.

methods.name: SetTextBlockVisibility
methods.doc: Sets the visibility of the text block.
